00058 void LRC_configError(int j, char* m){
00059   
00060   printf("%s\nLine %d: %s\n", LRC_E_CONFIG_SYNTAX, j, m);

00075 char* LRC_trim(char* str){
00076 
00077   char *ibuf = str, *obuf = str;
00078   int i = 0, cnt = 0;
00079 
00080   // Trap NULL.
00081   if (str){
00082  
00083     // Remove leading spaces (from RMLEAD.C).
00084     for (ibuf = str; *ibuf && isspace(*ibuf); ++ibuf)
00085       ;
00086     if (str != ibuf)
00087       memmove(str, ibuf, ibuf - str);
00088 
00089     // Collapse embedded spaces (from LV1WS.C).
00090     while (*ibuf){
00091       if (isspace(*ibuf) && cnt) ibuf++;
00092         else{
00093           if (!isspace(*ibuf)) cnt = 0;
00094             else{
00095               *ibuf = ' ';
00096               cnt = 1;
00097               }
00098             obuf[i++] = *ibuf++;
00099             }
00100           }
00101           obuf[i] = LRC_NULL;
00102 
00103      // Remove trailing spaces (from RMTRAIL.C).
00104      while (--i >= 0) { if (!isspace(obuf[i])) break;}
00105      obuf[++i] = LRC_NULL;
00106     }
00107 
00108   return str;
00109 }

00121 char* LRC_nameTrim(char* l){
00122 
00123   int len = 0;
00124 
00125   len = strlen(l);
00126 
00127   // Quick and dirty solution using trim function.
00128   l[0] = ' ';
00129   l[len-1] = ' ';
00130   l = LRC_trim(l);  
00131 
00132   return l;
00133 }

00148 int LRC_charCount(char* l, char* s){
00149   
00150   int i = 0; int sep = 0; int len = 0; 
00151 
00152   len = strlen(l);
00153 
00154   for (i = 0; i < len; i++){
00155     if((int) *s == l[i] ) sep++;
00156   }
00157   
00158   return sep;
00159 }

00177 int LRC_checkName(char* varname, LRC_configTypes* ct, int numCT){
00178    
00179   int i = 0, count = 0;
00180 
00181   for(i = 0; i < numCT; i++){
00182       if(strcmp(varname, ct[i].name) == 0) count++;
00183   }
00184   
00185   if(count > 0) 
00186     return 0;
00187   else
00188     return -1;
00189 
00190 }

00212 int LRC_matchType(char* varname, char* value, LRC_configTypes* ct, int numCT){
00213   
00214   int i = 0;
00215 
00216   while(i < numCT){
00217     if(strcmp(ct[i].name,varname) == 0){
00218       if(LRC_checkType(value, ct[i].type) != 0){ 
00219 //        printf("Error: %s -> %s ", varname, value);
00220         return -1;
00221       }else{
00222         return ct[i].type;
00223       }
00224     }
00225       i++;
00226   }
00227   return 0;
00228 
00229 }
00230 
00245 int LRC_checkType(char* value, int type){
00246   
00247   int i = 0, ret = 0, k = 0;
00248   char *p;
00249 
00250   switch(type){
00251     
00252     case LRC_INT:
00253       for(i = 0; i < strlen(value); i++){
00254         if(isdigit(value[i]) || value[0] == '-'){ 
00255           ret = 0;
00256         }else{
00257 //          printf("is not INT (followed by %d)\n", value[i]);
00258           ret = -1;
00259           break;
00260         }
00261       }
00262       break;
00263 
00264     case LRC_FLOAT:
00265       k = strtol(value, &p, 10);
00266       if(value[0] != '\n' && (*p == '\n' || *p != '\0')){
00267         ret = 0;
00268       }else{
00269 //        printf("is not FLOAT (followed by %s)\n", p);
00270         ret = -1;
00271       }
00272       break;
00273 
00274     case LRC_DOUBLE:
00275       k = strtol(value, &p, 10);
00276       if(value[0] != '\n' && (*p == '\n' || *p != '\0')){
00277         ret = 0;
00278       }else{
00279 //        printf("is not DOUBLE (followed by %s)\n", p);
00280         ret = -1;
00281       }
00282       break;
00283 
00284     case LRC_CHAR:
00285       for(i = 0; i < strlen(value); i++){
00286         if(isalpha(value[i]) || LRC_isAllowed(value[i]) == 0){
00287           ret = 0;
00288         }else{
00289 //          printf("is not STRING (followed by %d)\n",value[i]);
00290           ret = -1;
00291           break;
00292         }
00293       }
00294       break;
00295   
00296     default:
00297       break;
00298 
00299   }
00300 
00301   return ret;
00302 
00303 }

00318 int LRC_isAllowed(int c){
00319 
00320   char* allowed = "_-. ";
00321   int i = 0;
00322 
00323   for(i = 0; i < strlen(allowed); i++){
00324     if(c == allowed[i]) return 0;
00325  }
00326 
00327   return 1;
00328 }

00382 int LRC_textParser(FILE* read, char* SEP, char* COMM, LRC_configNamespace* configSpace, LRC_configTypes* ct, int numCT){
00383   
00384   int i = 0; int j = 0; int sepc = 0; int n = 0;
00385   char* line; char l[LRC_MAX_LINE_LENGTH]; char* b; char* c;
00386   int ret = 0; int err = 0;
00387 
00388   while(n < LRC_MAX_CONFIG_SIZE){
00389     
00390     // Count lines.
00391     j++; 
00392   
00393     if((feof(read) != 0)) break;
00394     line = fgets(l, LRC_MAX_LINE_LENGTH, read);
00395     
00396     // Skip blank lines and any NULL.
00397     if (line == NULL) break;
00398     if (line[0] == '\n') continue;
00399     
00400     // Now we have to trim leading and trailing spaces etc.
00401     line = LRC_trim(line);
00402 
00403     // Check for full line comments and skip them.
00404     if (strspn(line, COMM) > 0) continue;
00405     
00406     // Check for the separator at the begining.
00407     if (strspn(line, SEP) > 0){
00408       LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_MISSING_VAR); 
00409       goto failure;
00410     }
00411 
00412     // First split var/value and inline comments.
00413     // Trim leading and trailing spaces.
00414     b = LRC_trim(strtok(line,COMM));
00415 
00416     // Check for namespaces.
00417     if (b[0] == '['){
00418       if(b[strlen(b)-1] != ']'){
00419         LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_MISSING_BRACKET); 
00420         goto failure;
00421       }
00422 
00423       b = LRC_nameTrim(b);
00424       strcpy(configSpace[n].space,b); 
00425       i = 0;
00426       n++;
00427       continue;
00428     }
00429   
00430     // Check if in the var/value string the separator exist.
00431     if(strstr(b,SEP) == NULL){
00432       LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_MISSING_SEP); 
00433       goto failure;
00434     }
00435     
00436     // Check some special case:
00437     // we have separator, but no value.
00438     if((strlen(b) - 1) == strcspn(b,SEP)){
00439       LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_MISSING_VAL); 
00440       goto failure;
00441     }
00442 
00443     // We allow to have only one separator in line.
00444     sepc = LRC_charCount(b, SEP);
00445     if(sepc > 1){
00446       LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_TOOMANY_SEP); 
00447       goto failure;
00448     }
00449     
00450     // Ok, now we are prepared.
00451     c = LRC_trim(strtok(b,SEP));
00452 
00453     // Check if variable is allowed.
00454     if(LRC_checkName(c, ct, numCT) < 0){
00455       LRC_configError(j,LRC_E_UNKNOWN_VAR); 
00456       goto failure;
00457     }
00458 
00459     strcpy(configSpace[n-1].options[i].name,c);
00460   
00461     while (c!=NULL){
00462       if (c[0] == '\n') break;
00463       strcpy(configSpace[n-1].options[i].value,c);
00464       c = LRC_trim(strtok(NULL,"\n"));
00465     }  
00466 
00467     ret = LRC_matchType(configSpace[n-1].options[i].name, configSpace[n-1].options[i].value, ct, numCT);
00468     if(ret < 0){
00469       LRC_configError(j, LRC_E_WRONG_INPUT); 
00470       goto failure;
00471     }
00472 
00473     configSpace[n-1].options[i].type = ret;
00474 
00475     i++;
00476     configSpace[n-1].num = i;
00477   }
00478   return n;
00479 
00480 failure:
00481   return -1;
00482 }

00510 int LRC_hdfParser(hid_t file, LRC_configNamespace* cs, LRC_configTypes* ct, int numCT){
00511   
00512   hid_t group, dataset, dataspace, memspace;
00513   hid_t cc_tid;
00514   herr_t status, info, obj;
00515   hsize_t dims[2], dimsm[1], offset[2], count[2], stride[2];
00516   H5G_info_t group_info;
00517   H5O_info_t object_info;
00518   int opts = 0, i = 0, k = 0;
00519   char link_name[LRC_MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
00520   ssize_t link;
00521   hsize_t edims[1], emaxdims[1];
00522 
00523   LRC_configOptions rdata[1];
00524 
00525   // FIXME: [OPEN, NOT CREATE] Create compound datatype.
00526   cc_tid = H5Tcreate(H5T_COMPOUND, sizeof(LRC_configOptions));
00527   hid_t name_dt = H5Tcopy(H5T_C_S1);
00528   H5Tset_size(name_dt, LRC_MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
00529 
00530   hid_t value_dt = H5Tcopy(H5T_C_S1);
00531   H5Tset_size(value_dt, LRC_MAX_VALUE_LENGTH);
00532 
00533   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Name", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, name), name_dt);
00534   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Value", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, value), value_dt);
00535   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Type", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, type), H5T_NATIVE_INT);
00536 
00537   // Open config group.
00538   group = H5Gopen(file, LRC_CONFIG_GROUP, H5P_DEFAULT);
00539 
00540   // Get group info.
00541   info = H5Gget_info(group, &group_info);
00542 
00543   // Get number of opts (dataspaces).
00544   opts = group_info.nlinks;
00545 
00546   // Iterate each dataspace and assign config values.
00547   for(i = 0; i < opts; i++){
00548 
00549     // Get name od dataspace -> the namespace.
00550     link = H5Lget_name_by_idx(group, ".", H5_INDEX_NAME, H5_ITER_INC, i, link_name, LRC_MAX_SPACE_LENGTH, H5P_DEFAULT);
00551     strcpy(cs[i].space,link_name);
00552 
00553     // Get size of the table with config data.
00554     dataset = H5Dopen(group, cs[i].space, H5P_DEFAULT);
00555     dataspace = H5Dget_space(dataset);
00556     H5Sget_simple_extent_dims(dataspace, edims, emaxdims);
00557 
00558     cs[i].num = (int)edims[0];
00559 
00560     // Now we know how many rows are in data tables. 
00561     // Thus, we can read them one by one and assign to cs struct.
00562     for(k = 0; k < cs[i].num; k++){
00563       
00564       offset[0] = k;
00565       offset[1] = 1;
00566       
00567       dimsm[0] = 1; 
00568       dimsm[1] = 1;
00569 
00570       count[0] = 1;
00571       count[1] = 1;
00572 
00573       stride[0] = 1;
00574       stride[1] = 1;
00575 
00576       memspace = H5Screate_simple(1, dimsm, NULL);
00577       status = H5Sselect_hyperslab(dataspace, H5S_SELECT_SET, offset, stride, count, NULL);
00578       status = H5Dread(dataset, cc_tid, memspace, dataspace, H5P_DEFAULT, rdata);
00579 
00580       // Assign values.
00581       strcpy(cs[i].options[k].name, rdata->name);
00582       strcpy(cs[i].options[k].value, rdata->value);
00583       cs[i].options[k].type = rdata->type;
00584    
00585       H5Sclose(memspace);
00586     }
00587 
00588     H5Dclose(dataset);
00589     H5Sclose(dataspace);
00590 
00591   }
00592 
00593   H5Tclose(cc_tid);
00594   H5Gclose(group);
00595   
00596   return opts;
00597 }

00645 void LRC_writeHdfConfig(hid_t file, LRC_configNamespace* cs, int allopts){
00646 
00647   hid_t group, dataset, dataspace, memspace;
00648   hid_t cc_tid;
00649   hsize_t dims[2], dimsm[1], offset[2], count[2], stride[2];
00650   herr_t status;
00651   int i = 0, k = 0;
00652 
00653   LRC_configOptions ccd;
00654 
00655   group = H5Gcreate(file, LRC_CONFIG_GROUP, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT);
00656  
00657   // Create compound datatype.
00658   cc_tid = H5Tcreate(H5T_COMPOUND, sizeof(LRC_configOptions));
00659   hid_t name_dt = H5Tcopy(H5T_C_S1);
00660   H5Tset_size(name_dt, LRC_MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
00661 
00662   hid_t value_dt = H5Tcopy(H5T_C_S1);
00663   H5Tset_size(value_dt, LRC_MAX_VALUE_LENGTH);
00664 
00665   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Name", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, name), name_dt);
00666   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Value", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, value), value_dt);
00667   H5Tinsert(cc_tid, "Type", HOFFSET(LRC_configOptions, type), H5T_NATIVE_INT);
00668 
00669   for(i = 0; i < allopts; i++){
00670     
00671     dims[0] = cs[i].num;
00672     dims[1] = 1;
00673     dataspace = H5Screate_simple(1, dims, NULL);
00674     
00675     dataset = H5Dcreate(group, cs[i].space,cc_tid, dataspace, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT);
00676 
00677     // Write config data one by one in given namespace.
00678     for(k = 0; k < dims[0]; k++){
00679       
00680       offset[0] = k; 
00681       offset[1] = 0;
00682       
00683       dimsm[0] = 1; 
00684       dimsm[1] = 1;
00685       
00686       count[0] = 1; 
00687       count[1] = 1;
00688       
00689       stride[0] = 1;
00690       stride[1] = 1;
00691 
00692       memspace = H5Screate_simple(1, dimsm, NULL);
00693       status = H5Sselect_hyperslab(dataspace, H5S_SELECT_SET, offset, stride, count, NULL);
00694 
00695       strcpy(ccd.name,cs[i].options[k].name);
00696       strcpy(ccd.value,cs[i].options[k].value);
00697       ccd.type = cs[i].options[k].type;
00698 
00699       status = H5Dwrite(dataset, cc_tid, memspace, dataspace, H5P_DEFAULT, &ccd);
00700 
00701       status = H5Sclose(memspace);
00702     }
00703 
00704     status = H5Dclose(dataset);
00705     status = H5Sclose(dataspace);
00706   }
00707 
00708 
00709   status = H5Gclose(group);
00710   status = H5Tclose(cc_tid);
00711 
00712   return;
00713 }

00730 void LRC_printAll(int n, LRC_configNamespace* configSpace){
00731  
00732   int i = 0; int k = 0;
00733   
00734   for (i = 0; i < n; i++){
00735                 printf("Namespace [%s]:\n",configSpace[i].space);
00736     for (k = 0; k < configSpace[i].num; k++){
00737                         printf("\t%s = %s [type %d]\n",
00738           configSpace[i].options[k].name,
00739           configSpace[i].options[k].value,
00740           configSpace[i].options[k].type
00741           );
00742     }
00743     printf("\n");
00744   }
00745 }

00775 int LRC_parseConfigFile(char* inif, char* sep, char* comm, LRC_configNamespace* configSpace, LRC_configTypes* ct, int numCT){
00776   
00777   FILE* read;
00778   int opts;
00779 
00780         read = fopen(inif,"r");
00781         if(read != NULL){
00782     
00783     // Read and parse config file.
00784                 opts = LRC_textParser(read, sep, comm, configSpace, ct, numCT); 
00785         }else{
00786                 perror("Error opening config file:");
00787                 return -1;
00788         }
00789         fclose(read);
00790   
00791   return opts;
00792 }
